question.title: How to test my Login Rest API from the Postman Client by using Spring Boot
question.body:
I am trying to implement the Login Rest API for my Spring boot project and It throws the Status code as 500 internal server Error in the Postman Response

This the logic implementation I have used in my controller for my login REST API:

@PostMapping("/login")
    public ResponseEntity<String> login(@RequestBody LoginDto loginDto){
        String response=authService.login(loginDto);
        return  ResponseEntity.ok(response);
    }

And this is the logic for the Service implementation to validate the given details from database:

@Service
@RequiredArgsConstructor
public class AuthServiceImpl implements AuthService{
  private final AuthenticationManager authenticationManager;

  @Override
    public String login(LoginDto loginDto) {
        Authentication authentication=authenticationManager.authenticate(new UsernamePasswordAuthenticationToken(
                loginDto.getUsernameOrEmail(), loginDto.getPassword()));
        SecurityContextHolder.getContext().setAuthentication(authentication);
        
        return "User Logged-in Successfully";
    }

}

I have tried to test this API using this created url: http://localhost:7878/api/auth/login in Postman client.

The expected output is, it should show the status code- 200 and return the "User Logged-in Successfully"

but when I am trying to test this API, it gives me this type of error message in my console:

org.springframework.security.authentication.BadCredentialsException: Bad credentials

How can I resolve this issue?
